project.name: ThreePx
project.description: The size of this plane doesn't change when the html wrapper changes it's size.

THREEPX.name: THREEPX
THREEPX.description:
ThreePx synchronises the [three.js](href="http://threejs.org/") frustrum with that of the CSS.
See working examples in the examples folder.

params.name: wrapper
params.description:
The `THREEPX.renderer.domElement`
   will be added at position 0 of the wrapper.

params.name: options
params.description:
The default options are: * __configurable:__ `false`
Enable this option to override if you want override the API. * __autoInitializeThreejs:__ `true`
Enable or disable the creation of the scene, the renderer and the camera on the new ThreePx instance. * __autoResize:__ `true`
Enable or disable the bind between the wrapper size and the `THREEPX.renderer.domElement`. * __debug:__ `false`
Enable or disable some three.js elements added to the scene to debug.

classitems.description:
ThreePx need WebGL and requestAnimationFrame() to be used.
If these requirements are not satisfied canBeUsed property is set to false.
classitems.name: canBeUsed

classitems.description: The field of view given for the perspective property.
classitems.name: fov

classitems.description: The perspective parse from the wrapper CSS.
classitems.name: perspective
classitems.default: 2000 if CSS perspective is not defined for the wrapper.

classitems.description: Set to true if the view changed during the frame.
classitems.name: viewChanged

classitems.description:
If autoResize is set to true,
the size of the `THREEPX.renderer.domElement` is bind
to the wrapper size.
			 
*This property can be set in the options passed to the constructor.*
classitems.name: autoResize

classitems.description:
An user function called at the end of the render process.
The function must return true to make the renderer render.
classitems.name: renderFunction

classitems.description:
The actual width of the `THREEPX.renderer.domElement`.
If explicitWidth property is null or undefined, the width is equal to the `THREEPX.wrapper.clientWidth` else the width is equal to explicitWidth property.
classitems.name: width

classitems.description:
The actual height of the `THREEPX.renderer.domElement`.
If explicitHeight property is null or undefined, the width is equal to the `THREEPX.wrapper.clientHeight` else the height is equal to explicitHeight property.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
If the explicit width is not null or not undefined, the width is set tho the explicit width and the autoResize is not effective for the width.
*Update the value will generate a three.js render.*
classitems.name: explicitWidth

classitems.description:
If the explicit height is not null or not undefined, the height is set tho the explicit height and the autoResize is not effective for the height.
*Update the value will generate a three.js render.*
classitems.name: explicitHeight

classitems.description: Set to true if the wrapper changed during the frame.
classitems.name: wrapperChanged

classitems.description: The wrapper used by the instance of ThreePx.
classitems.name: wrapper

classitems.description: A flag to know if the scene has changed during the frame.
classitems.name: sceneChanged

classitems.description:
The three.js [scene](http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Scenes/Scene)
used by the instance of ThreePx.

*Camera will be automatically added to scene.*
classitems.name: scene

classitems.description: A flag to know if the renderer has changed during the frame.
classitems.name: rendererChanged

classitems.description:
The three.js [renderer](http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Renderers/WebGLRenderer)
used by the instance of ThreePx.
classitems.name: renderer

classitems.description: A flag to know if the camera has changed during the frame.
classitems.name: cameraChanged

classitems.description:
The three.js [camera](http://threejs.org/docs/#Reference/Cameras/PerspectiveCamera)
used by the instance of ThreePx.

*Camera will be automatically added to scene.*
classitems.name: camera
